intro: Atalantia roxburghiana var. roxburghiana, commonly known as the Indian mangosteen, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Clusiaceae and is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces edible, pinkish-purple fruits that are rich in antioxidants and have a sweet, tangy flavor. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and fruit. Its botanical features make it an important species in both horticulture and traditional medicine.
